reference.title: Enabling and Disabling Auto-Failover
reference.shortdesc: Auto-failover is enabled and disabled the POST /settings/autoFailover HTTP method and URI.

section.title: HTTP method and URI
section.p: This is a global setting that applies to all clusters. Authentication is required to change this value.

ul.li: enabled: Value is true or false. Indicates whether Couchbase Server performs auto-failover for the cluster or not.

timeout: Positive integer between 5 and 3600. The number of seconds a node must be down before Couchbase Server performs auto-failover on the node. Required if enabled=true; optional when enabled=false.

section.title: Example
section.codeblock: POST /settings/autoFailover HTTP/1.1 Host: 10.5.2.54:8091 Content-Type: application/x-www-form-urlencoded Authorization: Basic YWRtaW46YWRtaW4= Content-Length: 14 enabled=true&timeout=600

section.title: Response codes
section.codeblock: HTTP/1.1 200 OK Server: Couchbase Server Pragma: no-cache Date: Sat, 18 Oct 2014 00:26:28 GMT Content-Length: 0 Cache-Control: no-cache

400 Bad Request, The value of "enabled" must be true or false. 400 Bad Request, The value of "timeout" must be a positive integer bigger or equal to 30. 401 Unauthorized This endpoint isn't available yet.
